Message.Title: Joint position error
Message.Description: Actual position of joint is too far away from the ordered position.
Message.Actions: Check tuning parameters, external forces or hardware.

Message.Title: Too low DC-link voltage
Message.Description:
The drive units cannot detect the dc link voltage, or the voltage is too low.
This can occur if the DC link bus bar is not correctly inserted or if the mains contactors do not close properly.
Message.Actions:
Check the DC bus bar is correctly inserted between the drive unit and the rectifier.
Check that the motors on contactors are closed and that there is voltage on the side connected to the rectifier.

Message.Title: Corner path failure
Message.Description:
Task:
Corner path executed as stop point due to some of the following reasons:
- Time delay.
- Closely programmed points.
- System requires high CPU-load.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
- Reduce the number of instructions between consecutive move instructions.
- Reduce speed, use wider spaced points, use /CONC option.
- Increase ipol_prefetch_time.

Message.Title: Restart interrupted
Message.Description: Current position is too far from path.
Message.Actions: Make a new restart with regain.

Message.Title: Close to singularity
Message.Description:
Task:
Robot too close to singularity.
Program Ref.
(Internal code: )
Message.Actions: Modify path away from the singularity or change to joint interpolation.

Message.Title: Joint Out of Range
Message.Description: Position for joint is out of working range.
Message.Actions: Use the joystick to move the joint into its working range.

Message.Title: Jog in wrong direction
Message.Description: Position for joint is out of working range.
Message.Actions: Use the joystick to move the joint in opposite direction.

Message.Title: Command not allowed
Message.Description: System parameters cannot be changed in MOTORS ON state.
Message.Actions: Change to MOTORS OFF.

Message.Title: Command not allowed
Message.Description: An attempt was made to calibrate while in MOTORS ON state.
Message.Actions: Change to MOTORS OFF.

Message.Title: Command not allowed
Message.Description: An attempt was made to commutate the motors in MOTORS ON state.
Message.Actions: Change to MOTORS OFF.

Message.Title: Command not allowed
Message.Description: An attempt was made to synchronize in MOTORS ON state.
Message.Actions: Change to MOTORS OFF.

Message.Title: Correct regain impossible
Message.Description: A stop occurred with too many close points with corner zones. At restart the robot will move to a point farther forward in the program.
Message.Actions: Reduce the number of close points, increase the distance between them or reduce the speed.

Message.Title: MOTORS ON order ignored
Message.Description: MOTORS ON order ignored since the previous stop was not yet acknowledged.
Message.Actions: Order MOTORS ON again.

Message.Title: Robot in a singularity
Message.Description: The robot is too close to a singularity.
Message.Actions:
During program execution, use SingArea instruction or joint interpolation.
During jogging, use axis by axis.

Message.Title: Could not create path
Message.Description: The path could not be created.
Message.Actions:
- Increase the distance between close points.
- Decrease speed.
- Change acceleration.

Message.Title: Position outside reach
Message.Description:
Position for joint is outside working area.
Joint 1-6 : Number of the axis which causes the error.
Joint 23: Combination of axis 2 and 3 causes the error.
Message.Causes: The reason may be that ConfL_Off is used and a movement is too large, more than 90 degrees for an axis.
Message.Actions:
- Check work object or working range.
- Move the joint in joint coordinates.
- Check Motion configuration parameters.
- Insert intermediate points on large movements.

Message.Title: Joint speed error
Message.Description: The speed of joint is wrong relative the ordered speed due to error in system or collision.
Message.Actions:
- Check the tune parameters, external forces on the joint and hardware.
- Reduce programmed speed.

Message.Title: Too large revolution counter difference
Message.Description: Too large revolution counter difference for joint . The system has detected too large a difference between the actual revolution counter value on the serial measurement board and the value anticipated by the system.
Message.Consequences: The robot is not calibrated and may be jogged manually, but no automatic operation is possible.
Message.Causes: The position of the robot arm may have been changed manually while the power supply was switched off. The serial measurement board, resolver or cables may also be faulty.
Message.Actions:
1) Update the revolution counter.
2) Check resolver and cables.
3) Check the serial measurement board to determine whether it is faulty. Replace the unit if faulty.

Message.Title: Joint load too high
Message.Description: Actual torque on joint too high. Might be caused by incorrect load data, too high acceleration, high external process forces, low temperature or hardware error.
Message.Actions:
-Check load data.
-Reduce acceleration or speed.
-Check hardware.

Message.Title: Joint collision
Message.Description: Actual torque on joint is higher than ordered while at low or zero speed. Might be caused by jam error (the arm has got stuck) or hardware error.
Message.Actions:
Check that arm is not stuck.
Check hardware.
Check for other hardware event logs.

Message.Title: Joint not synchronized
Message.Description: The position of joint after power down/failure is too far away from the position before the power down/failure.
Message.Actions: Make a new update of the revolution counter.

Message.Title: Tool coord. system error
Message.Description: The z-direction of the tool coordinate system is almost parallel with the path direction.
Message.Actions: Change the tool coordinate system to achieve at least 3 degrees deviation between z-direction and path direction.

Message.Title: Incorrect tool
Message.Description: The definition of stationary tool is not valid.
Message.Actions: Check the tool and object data.

Message.Title: Circle uncertain
Message.Description:
Task:
The points are misplaced, reason :
1 End point too close to start point.
2 Circle point too close to start point.
3 Circle point too close to end point.
4 Uncertain reorientation.
5 Circle too large > 240 degrees.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the points of the circle and the end point of the move instruction before. The points of the circle can be verified by stepping trough the circle in manual mode.

Message.Title: Kinematics error
Message.Description: The destination of the movement is outside the reach of the robot or too close to a singularity. Robot .
Message.Actions: Change the destination position.

Message.Title: Robot not active
Message.Description: Attempt to coordinate motion or calculate position of deactivated robot .
Message.Actions: Activate robot via the Motion Unit key, then Jogging window, or program. Check work object and program.

Message.Title: Unit not active
Message.Description: Attempt to coordinate motion or calculate position of deactivated single unit .
Message.Actions: Activate unit via Motion Unit key, then Jogging window, or program. Check work object and program.

Message.Title: Orientation not correct
Message.Description: Orientation is incorrectly defined.
Message.Actions: Make an accurate normalization of the quaternion elements.

Message.Title: Too many close positions
Message.Description: Too many consecutive closely spaced positions.
Message.Actions: Increase the distance between consecutive close positions.

Message.Title: Cannot use wrist weaving
Message.Description: Wrist weaving not possible.
Message.Actions: Use smaller weaving amplitude or a larger TCP.

Message.Title: Position not compatible
Message.Description: The desired position cannot be reached with the given robot configuration. Robot .
Message.Actions: Modify the robot position in the program.

Message.Title: Deceleration limit
Message.Description: The path calculation for mechanical units running in Motion Planner exceeds internal limit. The Motion task did not execute within its time limit.
Message.Causes: The cpu load is to high. Could for example be generated by to frequent EIO communication.
Message.Actions:
1. Set system parameter High Interpolation Priority for the affected Motion Planner.
2. Try to reduce the cpu load by one or more of the following actions:
- Reduce speed
- Change AccSet
- Avoid singularity (SingArea\Wrist).
- Increase Path Resolution for the affected Motion Planner using system parameter or by using the RAPID instruction PathResol for critical movements.

Message.Title: Speed lowered by system.
Message.Description: The speed has been lowered by the system due to dynamic limitations.
Message.Actions: Decrease speed and/or do not use close positions at high speed and/or increase acceleration (if below 100%).

Message.Title: Too many user frames.
Message.Description: For mechanical unit more than one user frame has been defined.
Message.Actions: Take away one user frame or define one more mechanical unit.

Message.Title: Singularity problem
Message.Description: Too close to wrist singularity with respect to numerical resolution for joint 4 of .
Message.Actions: Change destination position a few increments.

Message.Title: Singularity problem
Message.Description: Too close to wrist singularity with respect to numerical resolution for joint 6 of .
Message.Actions: Change destination position a few increments.

Message.Title: Restart not possible
Message.Description: It is not possible to restart the path due to a previous error.
Message.Actions: Move the program pointer to clear the path and start a new movement.

Message.Title: Weaving changed
Message.Description:
Task:
The ordered weaving is not achieved due to:
- high weaving frequency
- not allowed shift of weave method or
- that SingArea/Wrist is used with wrist weave.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Increase weave length or period time.
Don't shift between arm and wrist weave.
Use SingArea/Off with wrist weave.

Message.Title: Restart not possible.
Message.Description: Restart no longer possible. Change of unit state made restart of program impossible.
Message.Actions: Move the program pointer and start a new movement.

Message.Title: Axis computer response
Message.Description: Incorrect response from axis computer.
Message.Actions:
Check Motion configuration parameters.
Check axis computer hardware.

Message.Title: TuneServo not possible
Message.Description: Tuning is not implemented for the specified joint.
Message.Actions: Verify that a parameter and/or joint that can be used with TuneServo is chosen.

Message.Title: TuneServo not allowed
Message.Description: Tuning is not allowed for the specified joint.
Message.Actions: Verify that a parameter and/or joint that can be used with TuneServo is chosen.

Message.Title: Commutation failed
Message.Description: Commutation failed for joint .
Message.Actions:
- Make a new commutation.
- Restart the system.

Message.Title: Test signal error.
Message.Description: No test signals are available for robot .
Message.Actions: Verify that correct test signals are defined.

Message.Title: Corr. vector warning
Message.Description: Sensor correction vector calculations failed due to previous error.

Message.Title: SoftAct not possible.
Message.Description: Soft servo is not possible to activate.
Message.Actions: Verify that a joint that can be used with SoftAct is chosen.

Message.Title: Arm check point limit
Message.Description: The robot has reached the limit for arm check point.
Message.Actions: Use the joystick to move the involved joint into the working range again.

Message.Title: Arm check point limit
Message.Description: Jogging was made in wrong direction when arm check point was out of working range for robot .
Message.Actions: Use the joystick to move the joint in opposite direction.

Message.Title: Payload too large
Message.Description: Heavy payload caused static torque limit to be exceeded on joint .
Message.Actions: Check and reduce payload for arm and/or wrist. Reduce joint working range to decrease static torque due to gravity.

Message.Title: Jog or Speed error
Message.Description:
One of the following problems occurred:
-Jogging error
-High speed error
-Robot too close to singularity
Message.Actions:
-Jog with incremental movement
-Reduce the programmed speed

Message.Title: Motion configuration
Message.Description: Configuration of the manipulator failed.
Message.Actions:
Check the parameter values under System parameters: Motion. If mismatch between INT/EXT parameters i.e. wrong MOC.cfg loaded.
I-start the system with correct parameters.

Message.Title: Robot axes configuration
Message.Description: Actual configuration is not the same as ordered and/or movement of any robot axis is larger than 90 degrees. Robot , axis .
Message.Actions:
Use SingArea_Wrist, ConfL_Off, modify position or insert intermediary point.
Proceeding in Auto mode will not be possible without correcting the configuration. To be able to move to the position anyway change to Manual mode and repeat start.

Message.Title: Displ frame uncertain
Message.Description:
Calibration of displacement frame uncertain for robot , due to one or several of:
- Wrong TCP.
- Reference points inaccurate.
- Reference points badly spaced.
Message.Actions:
If estimated error is unacceptable:
- Verify that correct TCP is used.
- Try more than 3 reference points.
- Be careful when positioning robot to reference points.

Message.Title: Kinematic limitation
Message.Description:
Kinematic limitation for robot , no solution found.
- Long segment.
- Position close to singularity.
- Joint 1, 2 or 3 out of range.
- Position outside reach.
Message.Actions:
- Insert an intermediary point to reduce the length of the segment.
- Use MoveAbsJ.
- Check working range.

Message.Title: Power fail restart failed
Message.Description: Re-creation of the path failed.
Message.Actions: Move the program pointer and start a new movement.

Message.Title: Command not allowed
Message.Description:
Task:
The given instruction, or command, was not allowed since the robot program was executing in a hold state.
(Internal code: )
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Modify program or stop program execution before issuing command.

Message.Title: Not an independent joint
Message.Description: Joint is not configured as an independent joint.
Message.Actions: Modify the program or configure the joint as an independent joint.

Message.Title: Corr. vector warning
Message.Description: Sensor correction vector X calculations failed due to previous error.

Message.Title: Sensor process missing
Message.Description: Sensor process missing during initialization. Named sensor process could not be found or initialized.
Message.Actions: Check process name in Motion and Process configuration files.

Message.Title: No external process
Message.Description: Attempt to coordinate motion or calculate position of single without an external process.
Message.Actions: Check process name in Motion and Process configuration files.

Message.Title: Cannot reach position
Message.Description: Programmed position of independent joint is outside working range and thus cannot be reached.
Message.Actions:
- Change the position.
- Check the joint working area limits.
- Check the used work object.

Message.Title: Internal position error
Message.Description: Error caused by internal numerical limitation.
Message.Actions:
- Reset independent joint.
- Reduce work area if extended.
- Remove or separate close points.

Message.Title: Position adjustment
Message.Description: External position adjustment too large. TCP speed, orientation speed, or external position speed exceed allowed robot performance.
Message.Actions:
- Reduce programmed TCP- and orientation speeds.
- Modify the path.
- WaitWObj closer to sync.
- Run in AUTO.

Message.Title: Deactivation not possible
Message.Description: Deactivation of mechanical unit may not be done while in independent mode.
Message.Actions: Make sure that independent mode is not used and try to deactivate again.

Message.Title: Warning: new sync
Message.Description: Warning: a new object sync signal has arrived while conveyor is active and program is running.

Message.Title: New sync on
Message.Description: New object sync arrived while conveyor was tracking the previous object. Cannot track two objects simultaneously.
Message.Actions: Reduce speed of conveyor. Increase programmed speed.

Message.Title: Speed too low
Message.Description: Numerical problem when interpolation of long segments with low speed and heavy additional axes or when interpolation close to singularity.
Message.Actions: Split segments with long interpolation time (path_resolution * 4 minutes) or change to joint interpolation or move position away from singularity.

Message.Title: MoveJ not allowed
Message.Description: MoveJ not allowed with work object coordinated with external position mechanical unit.
Message.Actions: Change interpolation mode or work object.

Message.Title: Fine point necessary
Message.Description: Use fine point when changing tool or work object coordination when work object is coordinated with external position mechanical unit.
Message.Actions: Create a fine point and then change the tool.

Message.Title: WObj not connected
Message.Description: The WObj is not connected to the conveyor . Robot TCP cannot be coordinated to work object. Object can be dropped because of time synchronization fault on conveyor node.
Message.Actions:
Check for missing WaitWObj.
Check for DropWObj occurring before end of coordination.
Check for time synchronization fault, see status on conveyor node.

Message.Title: Conveyor moving
Message.Description: Conveyor moving while attempt to coordinate robot TCP to conveyor work object while in prohibited mode.
Message.Actions: It is not possible to coordinate to conveyor while in Manual Reduced Speed, or stepping in Auto, and the conveyor is moving.

Message.Title: Conveyor not active
Message.Description: Conveyor was not active when attempt to coordinate robot TCP to conveyor work object.
Message.Actions: Make sure conveyor mechanical unit is active. Check for fine point for last coordinated motion before DeactUnit.

Message.Title: Unable to restart
Message.Description: Conveyor moving while attempting to restart or before pressing Stop or stepping through program.
Message.Actions: Make sure conveyor is standing still. Move the program pointer and start a new movement.

Message.Title: Non optimal movement
Message.Description: Required torque too high. Manual adjustment of acceleration or speed is needed.
Message.Actions: Reduce acceleration (AccSet 50 100) in this movement, restore it afterwards (AccSet 100 100). Optimize performance by search for max acceleration 50-99. Alternatively, reduce speed.

Message.Title: Out of coupled range
Message.Description: Joint and are out of coupled working range.
Message.Actions: Use the joystick to move joints into their coupled working range.

Message.Title: Jog in wrong direction
Message.Description: Joint and are out of coupled working range.
Message.Actions: Use the joystick to move joints into their coupled working range.

Message.Title: Robot outside work area.
Message.Description: The robot has reached the World Zone ,
Message.Actions: Check the reason of the World Zone. Use the joystick to move the robot out of the World Zone if needed.
